definition: victory or defeat/result

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to not be able to distinguish who's winning

sentences.english: Most of Tuesday's game hinged on the first inning.
sentences.chinese: 周二的比赛胜败关键在于第一局。

sentences.english: It's a tough assignment, and it will either make or break her.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个艰巨的任务，胜败在此一举。

sentences.english: Who do you feel can be the match-winner for Stoke and why?
sentences.chinese: 你认为决定斯托克胜败的人将是谁，以及理由。

sentences.english: The safety of America depends on the outcome of the battle in the streets of Baghdad.
sentences.chinese: 美国是否安全取决于巴格达巷战的胜败。

definition: victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
win or loss/outcome
commonplace in military operations (idiom)
a tie-break/to determine the winner
to live or die/to exist or perish
life or death
war situation
matter of life and death
the result becomes apparent/(after) the dust has settled
hard fighting/fierce battle
see 成則為王，敗則為寇|成则为王，败则为寇[cheng2 ze2 wei2 wang2 , bai4 ze2 wei2 kou4]
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
the enemy and us
matter of life and death
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
gains and losses/success and failure/merits and demerits
